wikipedia_page.main: Leslie Leopold Rudolph Hausburg (May 1872 – 3 July 1917) was a British philatelist who was one of the "Fathers of Philately".  His name was entered on the Roll of Distinguished Philatelists in 1921. He was also a leading tennis player.

response: * Leslie L. R. Hausburg, The Postage and Telegraph Stamps of British India ... Part I. Postage Stamps. London: Stanley Gibbons, 1907.
*The Postage and Telegraph Stamps of British India. London: Stanley Gibbons for the Philatelic Society of India, 1907. (With C.S.F. Crofton and Leslie L. R. Hausburg.)

Smith rekindled his boyhood interest in philately in 1885, from where it grew to be a consuming passion and a career that he pursued in preference to the law. He was a specialist in the stamps of South Australia and worked for Stanley Gibbons from 1893, becoming a director in 1898. He was active in organising the London Philatelic Exhibition 1897. His collection of South Australia, noted for being the best mint collection formed at the time, passed to Leslie L. R. Hausburg. He was a member of the London Philatelic Society, now the Royal Philatelic Society London, from 1892 and a member of their Council from 1897.

The Earl of Crawford won the Championship Cup for his Great Britain, while gold medals were awarded to Leslie L. R. Hausburg for his Victoria, to Baron Anthony de Worms for his Ceylon, Vernon Roberts for his Cape of Good Hope and a number of others.
